text: , the first son of Tadatsugu, was a kugyō or Japanese court noble of the Muromachi period (1336–1573). He held a regent position kampaku from 1445 to 1447. With a commoner he had sons and Masaie. His posthumous name is Go- Chisoku-In (後知足院). ==Career== * Ōei 33, on the 24th day of the 7th month (1426): Naidaijin (内大臣) * Eikyō 1, on the 4th day of the 8th month (1429): Udaijin (右大臣) * Eikyō 10, on the 4th day of the 9th month (1438): Sadaijin (左大臣) * Bun'an 2, on the 23rd day of the 11th month (1445): Kampaku (関白) and Ujichōja (氏長者)(Head of Fujiwara clan) * Bun'an 4, on the 15th day of the 6th month (1447): retire from Kampaku * Kanshō 2, on the 25th day of the 21st month (1461): Daijō Daijin (太政大臣) and Ju-Ichii (従一位) * Kanshō 4 (1463): retire from Daijō Daijin * Bunmei 6 (1474): He became a priest (Buddhist name - Daitsū, 大通). * Chōkyō 2, on the 19th day of the 10th month (1488): He died at the age of 87. ==References== * * Owada, T. et al. (2003). ‘’Nihonshi Shoka Keizu Jimmei Jiten’’. Kōdansya. (Japanese) Category:Fujiwara clan Category:Konoe family Category:1402 births Category:1488 deaths
title: Konoe Fusatsugu
